newsitem.title: POLAND: POLAND TO PICK REFINERIES SELL-OFF ADVISER BY JUNE.
newsitem.headline: POLAND TO PICK REFINERIES SELL-OFF ADVISER BY JUNE.

text.p: Nafta Polska SA, the holding supervising the modernisation and privatisation of Poland's oil sector, said on Tuesday it was likely to pick a firm to advise it on a sell-off of two refineries by the end of May.
"We expect to be able to select the adviser by the end of May," Nafta deputy president Marek Foltynowicz told Reuters in an interview.

He said Nafta expected about 25 investment banks and consulting firms to bid in a tender, announced on Monday, for adviser in the sale of Petrochemia Plock SA and Rafineria Gdansk SA -- Poland's two largest oil refineries.
The bidders have until April 21 to submit their offers.
Foltynowicz also said Nafta had postponed a deadline for placing initial offers for Plock and Gdansk to the end of April from the end of March.
Last month Nafta sent information on its privatisation plans to more than 20 international oil firms and Foltynowicz said most responses he had received so far were positive.
Nafta will announce a tender for the final bid for the refineries after it selects its privatisation adviser.
Under the government privatisation scheme, Nafta Polska will offer up to 30 percent of shares in the country's refineries to strategic investors, possibly this year.
The buyers would be allowed to increase their stakes in the refineries to over 50 percent after investing in the modernisation of the companies. -- Robert Bogdanski +48 22 653 9700
